description:
When the national idol Kusakabe Yuka suddenly retired from the entertainment business, it shocked the world and it devastated teenager Hata Kosaku. Kosaku was Yuka's biggest fan and her departure left him depressed. His classmates at the Tamo Agriculture School finally are able to get him to leave his room and attend his class, but to everyone's amazement, Kusakabe Yuka (her stage name) comes into the class under the name Kinoshita Ringo as a transfer student. Kosaku realizes he has the once in a lifetime opportunity to get to personally know his dream girl and, together with his group of friends, try to find out why she is here and become closer than just classmates.

(Source: MangaHelpers)
synonyms: ไอดอลสาวชาวไร่

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

alternative: Woodman Rintarou (ウッドマン林太郎)

node.description: **Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大沼心) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Oonuma)

After graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology he joined Office AO where he worked as an animator. He later joined Shaft in 2004 as a subcontractor, and he became [Akiyuki Shinbou's](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/) right hand until 2009. When he stopped working for Shaft, he found his new home at studio Silver Link, where he is to-date known as their most prominent director. Noted for directing shows such as [ef: A Tale of Melodies](https://anilist.co/anime/4789/), [Baka to Test](https://anilist.co/anime/6347/) and [Kokoro Connect](https://anilist.co/anime/11887/).

Oonuma is known to like so called moe games.

__Birth Place:__ Kanazawa City, Ishikawa, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nankagun) | [Blog](https://thurinus.exblog.jp/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ticketchan) | [Pixiv](http://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=27410)

__[Blog (JP)](http://forte-piano.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nijine)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Nana Prefectural Sakurai Senior High School (2001), Osaka College of Music (2004)

__Introduction:__
Akito Matsuda, also known by his alias Nijine, is a Japanese composer and arranger. He worked freelance as a composer and arranger until his employment with Popholic found place in 2007.

__Biography:__
Akito is mainly known for working under the name Nijine, which he did between 2006 through 2012, where he wrote the soundtracks for a handful of anime while also composing and arranging various anime songs. In 2013, he decided to start using his real name for his work instead. He is also known for working on several eroge soundtracks and vocal songs under the name Tokia (stylized as TOKIA) early on in his career.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

__[Website](http://kikuyatomoki.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Mitaka, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Tomoki Kikuya is a Japanese composer and arranger, who works for music studio Popholic. His brother Kikuya Hiroki (菊谷宏樹), is the director of TVK's saku saku music show.

__Biography:__
Kikuya started a career as guitarist in the music band Mustang A.K.A under Sony Records. Later he was part of Funanori. Starting from 2005 Kikuya decided to focus on working as a music composer and arranger. He has arranged and composed several songs featured in anime since then, starting with theme songs for Pani Poni Dash.

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

A close personal friend of [Kozue Amano](https://anilist.co/staff/96937/Kozue-Amano). She was invited on stage to Anime Festival Asia 2011.

In 2013, she married a man from outside the anime industry.

__Non anime roles:__
- Azami - Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (VG)
- Dorothy - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Jean](https://anilist.co/character/190865/Jean-Gunnhildr) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- [Kotori Kanbe](https://anilist.co/character/37486/) - Rewrite (VG)
- Mayer - Arknights (VG)
- [Wakamo Kosaka](https://anilist.co/character/287031/) - Blue Archive (VG)
- Changli - Wuthering Waves (VG)
- Castorice - Honkai Star Rail (VG)
- Metis - Persona 3 Reload : Episode Aigis -The Answer (VG)

node.description:
__Hobbies:__ making ribbon bows and sweets, writing poems, Phantasy Star Online

[Website](http://www.tamurayukari.com) | [Profile](http://amuleto.jp/talents/tamura_yukari.html) | [Music Profile](http://www.kingrecords.co.jp/cs/artist/artist.aspx?artist=15412) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/yukari_tamura) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yukari_Tamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%94%B0%E6%9D%91%E3%82%86%E3%81%8B%E3%82%8A) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@OfficialChannel-eu5sl)

She is a popular Japanese singer-songwriter and voice actress (seiyuu), currently affiliated with Amuleto (as seiyuu) and with King Records (as songstress). Affectionately called Yukarin by her fans, she is also known for her soft voice and interest in Lolita fashion. She made her debut as a voice actress in 1997, releasing her debut single Yuuki wo Kudasai on March 26, 1997.
While also a well-known seiyuu, several of her releases have been used as opening and ending themes for anime series, while some have reached the Oricon top 100 singles and album charts. Her role as Takamachi Nanoha in the Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha series contributed to a rise in her popularity, as several of her singles (Little Wish: Lyrical Step, Spiritual Garden, Hoshizora no Spica, Beautiful Amulet) were used as the ending themes for the franchise's anime adaptations.

Non-Anime Roles
- Nahida (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Qiqi (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Theresa Apocalypse (Honkai Impact 3rd) [VG]
- Vita Clotilde - The Legend of Heroes Series [VG]
- Yvette - Strinova [VG]

__Height:__ 156 cm (5'1")

[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/hanazawakana/) | [Website](http://www.hanazawakana-music.net/) | [Website 2](http://www.hanazawakana-music.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hanazawa_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hanazawa_kana.official/)  | [YouTube]( https://www.youtube.com/@hanazawa_kana/) | [Radio page](https://www.joqr.co.jp/qr/program/dekirukana/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@hanazawa_kana.official)

__Introduction__
Kana Hanazawa is a voice actress, actress, singer, former child actress, and talent represented by Office Osawa. In July 2020, she married fellow voice actor [Kensho Ono](https://anilist.co/staff/95819), whom she had been dating since 2017. 

__Early Career__
Hanazawa originally became a child actress at the age of 8. Amongst other roles, she starred in the well-known TV school show _Appare Sanma Daisensei_ and the TV series _Gakkou no Sensei_. At that time she was contracted to Big Apple, and later to Five Eight and Smile Monkey.

__Voice Acting Career__
At the age of 14, she made her voice acting debut in 2003 as Holly in _[Last Exile](https://anilist.co/anime/97/)_. Three years later in 2006, she was selected for a major role in TV Tokyo's anime mecha series _[Zegapain](https://anilist.co/anime/878/)_. She was playing the main character's childhood friend, [Kaminagi Ryouko](https://anilist.co/character/2578/), and her performance was one of the main reasons for the character's popularity amongst fans. It was afterwards that she came under contract at prestigious voice acting talent agency Office Osawa in 2007.

Hanazawa went to university in 2007, while at the same time, she began to make her mark as a voice actress. She was voted in 2010 as "Best Female Voice Actress" by listeners of the radio program Nonko and Nobita's Anime Scramble. She graduated from university in 2011, and in the same year became a full-time voice actress.

Hanazawa won Best Supporting Actress at the 9th Seiyuu Awards for her role as [Kosaki Onodera](https://anilist.co/character/52723/) in _[Nisekoi](https://anilist.co/anime/18897/)_. She also won Newtype's Best Voice Actress award in 2015 and later in 2018.

__Music Career__
On February 23, 2012, it was announced that Hanazawa would launch her official website. A few days later, during the Kana Hanazawa Solo Debut Presentation Party event, it was announced that she would release four singles within a year: "Hoshizora Destination" on April 25, "Hatsukoi no Oto" released on July 18, "Happy Endings" on October 24 (an ending theme for _[Zetsuen no Tempest](https://anilist.co/anime/14075/)_), and "Silent Snow" on January 16, 2013. Her first album Claire was released on February 20, 2013, and her second album 25 was released on February 26, 2014. She released an album title Blue Avenue in April 2015 and went on a concert tour starting at the Nippon Budokan on May 3. The Blu-ray release of the show, Live Avenue Kana Hanazawa in Budokan, ranked number six in sales.

__Trivia__
- She was invited to Anime Festival Asia 2010 on stage.
- She used to be a junior idol in Akihabara where hundreds of people came to watch her, which is how she got her breakthrough for her acting career in commercials before becoming a voice actress.

**Non-anime roles:**
- [Marie](https://anilist.co/character/89069/Marie) - Persona 4 Golden (VG)
- Hakari Atsuko - Blue Archive (VG)
- Illya - Memento Mori (VG)
- Marian - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Modernia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Alice Kuonji (Caster) - Fate/Grand Order (VG)
Originating from [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).
Originating from [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.
__Mike McFarland__ is an American voice actor, ADR Director, Script, and Line Producer at Funimation Entertainment.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jmichaeltatum)

Married to fellow voice actor [Brandon McInnis](https://anilist.co/staff/127809/).

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zachbolton6)

Also a line producer.

__Hometown:__ Riverside, California Twitter | Instagram Between voice acting, script-adapting, and directing, Patrick Seitz has had the pleasure of working on hundreds of different video games and anime series over the past 20 years. His voice credits include Endeavor MHA, Franky One Piece, Dio JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure, plus a variety of video game voices like Arthas Menethil and Garrosh Hellscream from World of Warcraft. Seitz’s script-adapting credits include the English dubs of the animated feature films Summer Wars and Wolf Children, as well as series such as Aggretsuko, and he has directed a bevy of Japanese RPGs. _Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_
Producer affiliated with Funimation

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.
